page.title: 08The Ruin of Castell Morgraig
page.content:
The ruins of the castle are sited on the steep escarpment of Craig Llanishen. They were first excavated in 1903 when digging revealed the remains of a large castle. The castle was pentagonal in plan with circular bastion towers at four of the corners and a rectangular keep at the fifth. There are virtually no signs of it ever having been lived in. Therefore it must have been built at a time when the Welsh were forced to withdraw before the formidable stronghold could be completed.
Much of the castle today is overgrown but with its superb panoramic view over Cardiff and the Bristol Channel it would make a very interesting historical monument.
